extension.name: Anti Brute Force
extension.description: Secure your Symphony backend against brute force and dictionary attacks

releases.release: - Fixed a bunch of typos. - Added a setting for the name of the $_SERVER tag that contains the IP address. This is usefull when running being a proxy, so you can get the real user IP. - Fixing issue #17 - IP were not added to colored lists properly via the UI (thanks @michael-e).
- Added a default sender email address, so email can be send even if nothing is set in the preferences. - Remove a left over var_dump
- Officially added Italian translation (thanks @DaveRev) - Fixed a bug when no email settings are set in config.php
- Officially added Russian translation (thanks @bzerangue) - Grouped navigation - Added a parameter for hidding Anti Brute Force menu to authors - Added alert when there are banned IPs

- **Major Security Update:** Make sure the extension warns the user if misconfigured: **Do not fail silently.** - UI Update for Symphony 2.3. - Do not display the unband page if current IP is not banned. - Minor security update - make sure we have an email address set and validate before send. - Make the current IP the default value in the input field only for whitelist.
- DEPRECATED - Use 1.3: If you still need support for Symphony 2.2.x, use version 1.1 - Compatibility update for Symphony 2.3
- Colored list feature added - Fix issues #5, and #7
- New data base scheme - New setting group, which was a copy/paste error -- breaks downward compatibility -- - Fix others errors (not bugs, errors): issue #3, #4, #6
- First release: Block login, Admin content page, ABF Facade/Singleton
